title: Rouble routed as Russian crisis escalates - business live | Business | The Guardian
summary: deputy governor : rate hike was choice between `` very bad and very very bad ''
russian central bank plans more measures .

documents.title: markets shrug off rouble crisis
text: despite the rouble slumping - even though russia hiked interest rates from 10.5 % to 17 % in a vain attempt to support the currency - global markets ended the day higher .
in the uk , investors latched onto the low inflation figures , betting that they made an interest rate rate unlikely in the near future .
weak us manufacturing figures had a similar effect , while positive german confidence figures and reasonable pmi data helped support european markets .

there was also some optimism after us secretary of state john kerry said russia had made some constructive moves towards possible reducing tensions in ukraine , the situation which prompted western sanctions on the country .

the final scores showed : the ftse 100 finished 149.11 points or 2.41 % higher at 6331.83 germany 's dax rose 2.46 % to 9563.89 france 's cac closed 2.19 % better at 4093.20 italy 's ftse mib added 3.27 % to 18,670.05 spain 's ibex ended 1.8 % up at 10,081.9 ahead of wednesday 's presidential poll , the athens market edged 0.26 % lower as for russia , the rouble is currently at 70/ $ 1 , off its worse levels of more than 80/ $ 1 but down on the day despite the rate rise .
the dollar denominated rts index has fallen 12.41 % .
meanwhile the oil price - another one of the pressures on the russian economy - continued to slide , with brent crude down 1.7 % at $ 60.01 as barrel after earlier falling close to $ 59 .
on wall street , the dow jones industrial average is currently 107 points or 0.63 % higher .
and on that note , it 's time to close up after a particularly volatile day on the markets .
thanks for all your comments , and we 'll be back tomorrow .

russia faces severe problems whatever the effect of its actions to support the rouble , says fatom consulting : if the policy 'works ' , and the slide in the rouble comes to an end , then a real rate of interest close to 8 % , coming on top of a substantial deterioration in russia 's terms of trade , is sufficient to push the economy into a recession deeper than that observed following the crisis of 1998 .
if the policy 'fails ' , and the ruble continues to fall , then the short- term consequences for the real economy are less severe .
but another sovereign default becomes almost inevitable .
it concludes : the [ russian central bank ] is caught between a rock and a hard place .

if it manages to stop the rot and put a floor under the rouble - and given the market reaction to last night 's move , that may involve the policy rate of interest going a long way beyond 17 % - then it will be left with a painfully tight monetary policy just as the combined effects of sanctions , and a dramatic fall in the value of its major export , begin to bite .
if it fails , and rouble/dollar continues its march towards 100 , then default becomes almost inevitable .
sovereign yields have moved sharply higher over the past few days , though at just over 16 % , they are hardly priced for default .
equities would suffer in either of our two scenarios .
in us dollar terms , the micex has fallen around 50 % since the summer .
that is quite a fall , but it is nothing compared to the declines witnessed back in 1998 .
the rouble has now recovered some ground , now standing at 69/ $ 1 .
not good , given the overnight hike in interest rates to 17 % , but not as bad as the level of more than 80/ $ 1 seen earlier .
nicholas johnston ( @ firstwordnick ) had n't noticed any charts of ruble vs oil so i made one myself and whoa uncanny !

amid much talk of capital controls in russia , reuters has some new snaps : 16-dec-2014 16:07 - russian prime minister discussed difficult situation on currency market with top policy makers - ria novosti cites economy minister 16-dec-2014 16:08 - current market situation calls for supporting russian banking sector to ensure stability - ulyukayev 16-dec-2014 16:09 - capital controls not discussed at medvedev meeting - ulyukayev 16-dec-2014 16:10 - russian central bank overnight decision to raise rates came late - ulyukayev
meanwhile the us manufacturing sector grew in december but the growth rate hit an 11 month low .
markit 's preliminary manufacturing purchasing managers index fell to 53.7 from 54.8 in november , and lower than the 55.2 expected .
chris williamson of markit said : softer output and employment numbers merely represent a cooling in the pace of expansion from unusually strong rates earlier in the year .
[ but the data ] also send a warning light to policymakers that the fourth quarter is likely to see a weakening in the pace of economic growth .
so wall street too is shrugging off the rouble 's woes , with the data again suggesting the us federal reserve will continue to be cautious about any increase in borrowing costs .
with the rouble crashing and russia in crisis , other global markets must be tanking , surely ?
actually , no .
the ftse 100 is up around 0.58 % , thanks to weak uk inflation figures which hit their lowest level for 12 years and pushed any prospect of an interest rate rise even further into the distance .

in europe , the zew german confidence index showed its biggest monthly increase since january last year , while the latest snap purchasing managers indices seemed reasonably stable , given the recent turmoil in greece and russia .
carsten brzeski at ing bank said : this morning 's confidence indicators sent again mixed signals on the state of the eurozone 's biggest economy .
on the positive side , the zew index just suggested a new party atmosphere amongst investors with the headline number staging the strongest monthly increase since january 2013 .
over the last two months , the zew index has increased from a depressive -3.6 in october to 34.9 in december .
at the same time , the current assessment component also increased , albeit at a slower pace , from 3.2 in october to 10 in december .
earlier today , however , the latest pmis were less encouraging .

while the sharp increase of the pmi manufacturing ( from 49.5 to 51.2 ) indicated that lower oil prices have finally reached the industry , pmi services continued its downward trend since the summer .
the pmi composite dropped slightly to 51.4 , from 51.7 in november .
making sense of these diverging signals and indicators is not easy .

while the stronger zew reading is probably the logical result of lower energy prices and the belief in the healing power of the ecb current measures and , of course , upcoming qe , understanding the pmi remains a mystery .
over recent months , the pmi has failed to show any reliable predictive power .
we can not simply ignore it but until thursday 's ifo indicator release , we will store the pmi data in the file labelled not important '' and go along with the zew 's positive mood .
so germany 's dax is currently up 0.81 % while france 's cac has climbed 0.28 % .
russia 's prime minister dmitry medvedev today .
yekaterina/shtukina yekaterina/itar-tass photo/corbis moscow has announced that dmitry medvedev has met with a group of top officials , including central bank chief elvira nabiullina .

reuters has the details : russian prime minister dmitry medvedev held a meeting on tuesday with top central bank and government officials on the country 's financial and economic situation , according to a press release published on the government 's website .

the meeting was attended by first deputy prime minister igor shuvalov , an aide to the president of russia andrei belousov , finance minister anton siluanov , economic development minister alexei ulyukayev , central bank governor elvira nabiullina and first deputy chief of staff of the government maxim akimov , '' the government said in the press release .
it would not reveal any more details about the meeting .

and here 's the official line from moscow , from dmitry peskov , a spokesman for president vladimir putin : it is true that there is turbulence on the market , which can be largely explained by emotions and a speculative mood . ''

documents.title: deputy governor : rate hike was choice between `` very bad and very very bad ''
text: interfax has published more quotes from russia 's deputy central bank governor , sergei shvetsov .
shvetsov has described last night 's shock interest rate hike , from 10.5 % to 17 % , as a choice between the very , very bad '' and the merely very bad '' .
shvetsov said : the situation is critical .
what is happening now we could not have imagined in a nightmare a year ago .
but unfortunately we can not predict the short term perspectives of our financial markets .
many players are in a difficult position thanks to these events .
believe me , the choice that the central bank council made yesterday was a choice between the very bad and the very , very bad .
what is happening today and in recent days will have various consequences .
more here : банк россии назвал критической ситуацию на валютном рынке
another newsflash from moscow - kremlin sources are saying the slump in the rouble today was largely caused by emotions '' and a speculative mood '' .

the ft 's correspondent in moscow , jack farchy , is watching the russian cash machines , and reports that euros are in demand : jack farchy ( @ jfarchy ) bank workers coming out to withdraw some hard currency jack farchy ( @ jfarchy ) man in front of me is on his fifth withdrawal of fistfuls of hundred-euro notes # moscow
shares on wall street have dipped at the start of trading , as the russian crisis and the ongoing oil price slide hits shares .
the dow jones industrial average is down 75 point , a drop of 0.4 % , to 17120 .
the slump in the rouble could trigger russia 's downgrade to junk status , warns timothy ash , analyst at standard bank .
ash says that if the rouble remains around 70/ $ 1 in 2015 , then russia 's gdp in dollar terms would collapse to $ 1.1trn , from $ 2.1bn last year .
that would double the country 's external debt/gdp ratio to 70 % '' , he says .
a recession , and the cost of recapitalising russian banks , would also push the russian budget into deficit .

ash also cites the damage to confidence in russia 's central bank , the possibility of capital controls , and the danger the geopolitical risks will hit russia 's ability and willingness ' to repay its debts .
russian bonds have already fallen sharply in recent weeks .
so the market has already given its verdict .
as ash puts it : now you could well argue that russia is already trading as junk , so no big market impact .
indeed , russia has enough problems to deal with anyway , and a rating downgrade would be the last of its worries at this stage .
currency exchange offices in moscow have been left reeling by the dramatic changes in the rouble today .

this office widened its buy-and-sell spreads dramatically , and must be relieved that the rouble is now 'only ' at 90 to the €1 , having hit 100 briefly : lorcan roche kelly ( @ lorcanrk ) going to need a bigger sign mt @ twitterid : !
rt @ twitterid : currency rates in moscow 's exchange offices now another operation appears to have thrown in the towel : jack farchy ( @ jfarchy ) sometimes , you just have to give up .
# обменвалют # moscow # rouble
russia is being dragged deeper into the mire by the oil price , which continues to fall today .
brent crude has lost another 3 % today to $ 58.91 per barrel , a new five and a half-year low .
economists estimate that russia needs the oil price to be around $ 100/barrel to break even .
the lower it goes , the more damage is caused to russia 's finances .

nicholas spiro of spiro sovereign strategy reckons oil will destabilise president putin : putin rode the wave of higher oil prices in the years after he came to power , but there is no question that the economics will start to adversely impact the politics , '' the pieces are falling into place to start to affect the political sustainability of this regime . ''
bloomberg business ( @ business ) chart : russia 's ruble wrecked after rate hike
russia 's largest bank , sherbank , is being battered on the stock market .
shares in sherbank have tumbled 23 % today , as traders react to last night 's massive interest rate hike , to 17 % , and the slide in the rouble today .
the head office of the central bank of the russian federation in moscow today .
shipenkov/epa

documents.title: russian central bank plans more measures
text: russia 's central bank will implement more measures to stabilise domestic markets following a rate hike , its first deputy governor sergei shvetsov said on tuesday ( via reuters ) .
shvetsov also called the situation on the russian foreign exchange and stock markets critical . ''
at pixel time , the rouble is currently hovering around 73 to the us dollar , a 10 % slump today .
and the main moscow index , the rts , is still deep in the red - down 12 % today .

just seeing some news flashes from the russian central bank , on the reuters terminal : russian central bank first deputy governor says central bank will take more measures after rate hike russian central bank first deputy governor says situation on forex and stock markets critical
a currency exchange office this morning .
golovkin/ap there 's no sign of panic on the streets of moscow , according to bloomberg 's jason corcoran .
jason corcoran ( @ jason corcoran ) just been in central moscow branches of citigroup , raiffeisen , vtb24 .
no panic or big queues even as # ruble tanks .
narod resigned to fate

documents.title: russian pm to discuss 'financial situation '
text: russian prime minister dmitry medvedev .
/ barcroft media the interfax news agency is reporting that prime minister dmitry medvedev will hold a meeting on the financial situation '' today .

interfax says : opening the meeting of the government commission on the development of the far east , the prime minister said that after the meeting intends to discuss with colleagues the current situation in the financial markets .
in financial matters we still get together with colleagues today and talk '' , medvedev said .
( translation via google ) howard amos ( @ howardamos ) medvedev is taking charge .
russian pm to convene government meeting on financial situation today : ( rus )
heads-up !
the rouble is now strengthening .
having lurched down to the 80/ $ 1 mark , the russian currency has now re-bounced back to the 72/ $ 1 mark .
rouble vs us dollar today ( higher = weaker ) reuters that 's still a massive decline on the day .
it suggests that the russian central bank may be intervening in the markets , selling dollars and buying roubles to give the battered currency some support .

steve collins ( @ tradedesk steve ) talk cbr is in the mkt rub at around 72 vrs high of 79 joseph weisenthal ( @ thestalwart ) if i had woken up and the ruble were at 72.6 , i 'd be stunned at the collapse .
now it almost feels like a victory for russia .
lorcan roche kelly ( @ lorcanrk ) cbr interest rates : 17 % ruble losses today : > 17 %

political analyst ian bremmer of eurasia group flags up that russia 's crisis can not be dismissed as a little local difficulty : ian bremmer ( @ ianbremmer ) the collapse of a mid-sized economy is a modest global challenge .
the collapse of a major geopolitical power is another matter entirely .
the cost of insuring russian government debt against default has surged today to a new five and a half-year high .
a five-year russian credit default swap now costs 656 basis points , a jump of 109bp from yesterday .
that means it would cost $ 656,000 per year to insure $ 10m of russian debt .

documents.title: rouble hits 100/€1
text: i 'm afraid there 's no relief for the rouble - the russian currency just crashed through the 100 mark against the euro , and hit 80 to the dollar .
chris adams ( @ chrisadamsmkts ) rouble hits 80 to the dollar and 100 against the euro !
joseph weisenthal ( @ thestalwart ) once again .
if you 're just waking up , the huge central bank hike failed massively .
ruble getting pulverized .
the tumbling rouble puts more pressure on moscow to impose capital controls , to prevent people withdrawing cash from the banks and taking it out of the country .
luis costa , a senior analyst at citi , says : we think capital controls as a policy measure can not be off the table now . ''
the rouble has also been routed against the euro today , and is on the brink of breaching the 100 rouble to the €1 mark .
peter schiff ( @ peterschiff ) the russian rubble may be plunging against the u.s. dollar , but few have noticed that it 's falling even faster against the euro and the yen !
steve collins ( @ tradedesk steve ) usdrub 77 just getting ridiculous now
make that 77 roubles to the $ 1

documents.title: russian stock market slides
text: moscow 's stock market is n't a pretty today either .
the rts index of leading shares has slumped by 14 % so far today , as the slumping rouble puts more pressure on companies who need to finance debts in foreign currencies .
the rts index over the last three months .
reuters and some companies , such as oil firm bashneft and airline aeroflot , have seen more than a fifth wiped off their markets capitalisation .
biggest fallers on the rts index , december 16 2014 reuters
there 's no respite for the rouble , it 's now on the brink of hitting 75 to the $ 1 .
ransquawk ( @ ransquawk ) rub > 74 this is beginning to get a bit old
some economists had hoped that last night 's huge interest hike , from 10.5 % to 17 % , would give the rouble a much-needed boost .
instead , the markets are viewing the hike - which came at 1am moscow time - as a sign of panic .

daniel sugarman , market strategist at etx capital , says : the sudden shift by the rcb has certainly not done anything to dispel the sense of desperation emanating from moscow as the rouble continues its tumble .
rouble vs dollar over the last three months reuters
at 73 roubles to the us dollar , the russian currency has shed more than 10 % today alone .
steve collins ( @ tradedesk steve ) rub down 10 % on the day total swing about 18.5 % three months ago , it was trading at below 40 roubles to the $ 1 .

nicholas ebisch , currency analyst at caxton fx , warns that : elvira naibullina and the russian central bank feel that the rouble is undervalued , but with the price of oil falling and western sanctions continuing to take a toll on economic output , the rouble is in the middle of a currency crisis with no end in sight . ''

earlier today russia 's embattled central bank chief , elvira nabiullina , urged russians to face reality : we have to learn to live in a different zone , to orient ourselves more towards our own sources of financing , and to give a chance to import substitution '' russians must get used to new way of life after rouble crash , says bank chief
ed conway ( @ edconwaysky ) the russian ruble has now halved since aug .
falling rapidly again today , despite 17 % interest rates .
this is a real capital market crisis
sheesh , the rouble has now hit 73 to the us dollar .
it 's a fullblown rout .

documents.title: rouble in freefall
text: the russian financial crisis is deepening by the minute , as the rouble ploughs into fresh record lows .
the rouble has ploughed to a new all-time low of 69 to the us dollar in the last few minutes .
last night 's huge shock rate hike from the russian central bank has failed to shore up confidence in the russian currency .
a spectacular throw of the dice , but it 's not worked rouble vs the us dollar this week .
reuters laith khalaf , senior analyst at hargreaves lansdown , warns that raising rates to 17 % will cause fresh pain to the russian economy .
and the tumbling rouble will make it harder for russian companies to repay foreign dents , khalaf explains : 'the russian central bank has moved to battle stations to defend its currency .
so far the move has not stopped the slide , and it may yet have negative effects on the russian economy .

international investors will remember how the currency crisis of 1998 and subsequent default on sovereign bonds brought wall street to its knees , via the exposure of the giant hedge fund , long term capital management .
while the currency has significantly weakened this year , default by the government looks unlikely this time around because russia has relatively low levels of government debt compared to gdp .
despite this , the russian economy and companies do face serious problems .
rising interest rates will take a toll on a country which is already on the brink of recession .
if the price of oil remains around $ 60 in 2015 , russia could see economic growth contract by 4.5 % , according to the bank of russia .
meanwhile some russian companies will have debts denominated in foreign currencies , which will put them under further financial pressure .

documents.title: stress tests : what the experts say
text: reaction to today 's uk bank stress test results has been flooding in .
here 's a brief selection .
dan taylor , partner at accountancy firm bdo , points out that the uk has been more stringent than the eu authorities , who tested banks in october .
the relative severity of the bank of england 's latest stress tests are a sign of the new world in which we live .

these results should give some assurance about the strength of the uk banking system - particularly when compared to other banks across europe '' john thanassoulis , professor of financial economics at warwick business school , is concerned that everyone now knows that certain banks must now sell assets : for example the co-operative bank has now been required to sell a large part of its mortgage book .
a forced seller is one who will not receive a good price .
the second downside is that the reputational damage of doing things of which the bank of england does not approve will make banks risk averse .
whether this is bad is a question of degree .
but if lending costs rise for individuals and businesses in the medium term then the poorest consumers and the small entrepreneurs will be the ones who suffer first .

and john lunn , executive director at transformation consultancy moorhouse , agrees with mark carney that the sector is in better shape than before 2008 : however , as the sector continues to rebuild its underpinning foundations , the warning by the bank of england that rebuilding confidence requires more than focussing on financial resilience is in our view the most important finding .

as the industry grapples with darwinian transformations to the standard operating models , uk banks that are better able to focus both on ensuring operational resilience and innovation through delivering a better customer experience will be the overall winners post the banking crisis .

documents.title: boe press conference : the key points .
text: bank of england governor mark carney speaking to the press today .
rain/epa the bank of england 's press conference to discuss today 's bank stress tests , and the latest financial stability report , is over .
not a humdinger , but there were some interesting lines .
1 ) governor mark carney tried to calm concerns that the unfolding economic crisis in russia could rock britain .
he insisted that the city is less exposed today than during the 1998 currency crisis , and argued that moscow is suffering a unique situation due to western sanctions .
2 ) he hailed the recent 40 % -plus tumble in the oil price as an unambiguous good thing for the uk economy .
3 ) the uk inflation rate will fall further from this morning 's 12-year low , carney predicted .
but it 's not a threat to stability , and it wo n't force the bank wo n't change its policy stance .

mark broad ( @ markabroad ) mark carney says he expects inflation to go below 1 % and expects to write a letter to the chancellor 4 ) carney said next year 's stress tests will be widened to include more international factors such as emerging markets .
capitalcityifr ( @ capitalcityifr ) boe warns that next year banks will face tougher checks of their capital strength and international exposure .
given the unfolding geopolitical and market tensions , it 's a shame this year 's tests were n't broader frances coppola ( @ frances coppola ) wonderful .
the very day the stress test results are released , governor carney admits they tested the wrong scenarios .
5 ) and carney said the board of lloyds should be cautious about restarting paying dividends to shareholders , given its need to continue strengthening its capital reserves .
the london stock market has risen since the uk inflation data hit the wires , as traders calculate that interest rates are going to stay low for longer .
the ftse 100 is up 40 points at 6222 , up 0.6 % .
other european markets are also higher , partly due to a better-than-expected measure of german investor confidence .
ben chu ( @ benchu ) cpi inflation 1 % in november , lowest since 2002 .
and oil prices fallen since .
carney will be writing letter soon :

back to the surprise drop in uk inflation to a 12-year low of just 1.0 % liberal democrat chief secretary to the treasury , danny alexander , says it 's good news : falling oil prices have helped push inflation to its lowest level since 2002 .
this is a welcome early christmas present to millions of families across the country .
and , as the liberal democrat treasury minister , i am determined that the continuing oil price falls will be passed on to consumers as quickly as possible and in full .
what would you do about the uk government 's stakes in rbs and lloyds if you were chancellor of the exchequer in the next government , asks our city editor jill treanor .
there 's no chance that i 'll be chancellor after the next election , carney smiles .
he points out that lloyds is well through its turnaround plan , but does n't offer any specific advice .
is the drop in inflation to a 12-year low of just 1.0 % a worry , asks james titcomb of the telegraph .
in terms of financial stability , no , carney replies .
we do expect inflation to fall below 1 % in the coming months .
i expect to write a letter to the chancellor [ explaining why inflation has fallen far from its 2 % target ] , and our policy position will not change .
asa bennett ( @ asabenn ) bank of england 's jon cunliffe makes clear `` biggest risk [ to financial stability ] is still the housing market ''
what 's the biggest threat to the stability of the uk economy ?
it 's still the housing market , replies deputy governor sir john cunliffe .

documents.title: carney : lloyds needs permission before restarting dividends
text: back to the bank stress tests .
manus cranny of bloomberg asks whether the boe would be happy if lloyds started repaying dividends .
carney : we looked at each bank 's dividend policy at the start of the stress tests lloyds are n't paying dividends today , so we simply rolled that forwards when assessing their capital strength .

dividends are a matter for lloyds ' board but , any decision must be consistent with their continual need to rebuild capital , and they 'd need the permission of the prudential regulatory authority before they started paying dividends , carney adds .
as covered earlier this morning , lloyds only narrowly passed the stress tests , having build up capital this year .
reminder , the press conference is being streamed here ( the audio 's been fixed too , thanks !
a question on the eurozone , and whether the european central bank should start buying government bonds through a new quantitative easing programme .
mark carney offers his counterpart at the ecb , mario draghi , some support .
the ecb is right to be planning to expand its balance sheet , he says .
it 's not up to the bank of england to say how it does it .
europe is the uk 's largest trading partner , so we would welcome measures that would accomplish moving the eurozone back towards its targets .
carney defends the bank 's decision to rein in the mortgage market this summer , by restricting lenders from making many loans at more than 4.5 times a borrowers ' income .
we do n't want large swathes of the population to move to high loan-to-value ratio mortgages , at a time when rates are at record lows .
that mistake has been made before
are there tensions between the bank of england and the government over the housing market ?
the fundamental issue in the uk is a lack of supply , has been for decades , mark carney replies .
the bank ca n't fix that .
the bank has met its objective , which is to ensure that the banking system can keep lending even if the market crashes .
it 's the government 's job to worry about supply , and we 'll all try to deliver sustainable economic growth .
sam fleming ( ft ) ( @ sam1fleming ) mark carney cautions on direct parallels with russia in 1998 ; interlinkages into core of global financial system are lower than then .
guardian economics editor larry elliott asks whether mark carney is right to say the uk 's exposure to the russian crisis is limited .
that 's what we thought before the 1998 russian crisis carney defends himself .
in 1998 , he argues , the city was more directly exposed to russian assets - there were many more assets on the balance sheets of the large interbroker dealers related to russia .
the core linkages in the financial system today are very different than 1998 , he says .
carney does point out that the bank 's survey of risk managers found that geopolitical risk is their top threat .
but , he argues we have built extra resilience into the system to cope .
ed conway ( @ edconwaysky ) here 's what contributed to the fall in cpi inflation .
primarily transport ( eg fuel ) and recreation

documents.title: uk inflation falls to 1.0 %
text: crumbs .
the uk inflation rate has fallen to just 1.0 % in november , from 1.3 % in october .
that 's the lowest rate since 2002 , and a bigger fall than expected .

documents.title: carney : falling oil price is unambiguously positive for uk
text: kamal ahmed of the bbc asks how the falling oil price will affect inflation .
oil is still a net positive development , carney replies .
the 40 % plus drop in the oil price will flow quite quickly to consumers , it will boost disposable income .
and the exposure of the uk economy to the oil industry is managable .
it is unambiguously net positive for the uk , he repeats .

documents.title: carney : russia is a somewhat unique risk
text: onto questions .
sam fleming of the ft asks : how will next year 's stress tests will consider the growing risks from abroad , such as emerging markets .
and what work are you doing about russia ?
carney : this year 's test did consider the impact of a european recession , but no , it did n't look at emerging markets .

next year 's stress tests will focus more global risks , including emerging markets [ a big area for standard chartered and hsbc ] we are focusing very closely on a range of emerging markets and markets that appear to be liquid but turn out not to be .
on russia specifically the uk 's direct exposure to russia is pretty modest , with a relatively limited direct effect , carney says .
the situation in russia is somewhat unique - other countries are hit by the oil price , but few are also facing sanctions , he adds .
jill treanor ( @ jilltreanor ) carney says bank of england monitoring risks across a range of emerging markets , adds direct exposure to russia is very modest
since the crisis , authorities around the world have been working to make the financial system safer and better able to cope with shocks , carney explains .
in the uk , banks have raised capital .
there is growing confidence in our system , and that appears to be merited .
but then he turns to 'conduct issues ' - a reference to the various financial scandals that have dogged the financial sector .
strong , effective and well-informed governance is essential , carney warns .
carney says the stress test gives the bank of england a better view of the co-op bank 's capital needs .
we should n't be surprised that it failed .
jill treanor ( @ jilltreanor ) mark carney outlines risk that shale companies might struggle to make debt repayments , biggest risk to financial stability now international
argh , the audio feed from the bank of england 's hastily relocated press conference is pretty bad - reminiscent of the moon landing .
amid the squeaks , blips , and outages , mark carney is explaining that the main risks to the uk financial sector comes from overseas ( a point i flagged up at 7.52am ) .

documents.title: bank of england financial stability report press conference
text: the bank of england ( delayed ) press conference starting now - it 's being streamed live here .
the gloves are coming off in russia as the rouble hits new lows , tweets our moscow correspondent shaun walker .
shaun walker ( @ shaunwalker7 ) rouble is tumbling again after briefly holding up , and signs of elite battle breaking out .
kudrin criticising sechin , rosneft criticing cb .
duncan weldon ( @ duncanweldon ) ruble opened up 9 % .
now given that all back .
long day ahead for the russian central bank .
oh dear .
the bank of england 's press conference to discuss the bank stress test results , and its financial stability report , has been hit by a power cut .
the press pack are being marched down the road to another room with press conference facilities , so it might be a few minutes later than planned ( we were due to start at 9am ) .
jill treanor ( @ jilltreanor ) bank of england has power problems so press conference delayed
back to the uk bank stress tests and the financial markets appear to be taking them in their stride .

most bank shares are up this morning ( co-op , the only failure , are n't listed on the stock exchange ) : mark barton ( @ markbartontv ) and the verdict on uk bank stress tests is ( a couple of minutes into the session )
robin wigglesworth ( @ robinwigg ) good grief !
rouble slides to new record low despite massive overnight rate hike
eek .
the rouble is now actually down against the us dollar today , despite interest rates being raised to an eye-watering 17 % overnight in an attempt to shore up the currency .
as fastft point out , the mood in the central bank must be pretty grim this morning .
and the russian stock index , the rts , is being routed ; down over 9.7 % .
francesco papadia ( @ francescopapad1 ) # putin sinks the rouble or brings rates to unbearable levels , # erdogan does the same with the lira .
how long will their citizens allow this ?
some market news briefly .
brent crude has fallen through the $ 60 per barrel mark for the first time since 2009 , as the oil price continues to slide .
and the russian rouble has been swirling around on the foreign exchange markets after its central bank stunned the markets by hiking interest rates to 17 % overnight .
the rouble initially surged around 7 % , but has since dropped back against the us dollar .
yesterday it plunged by over 10 % before the bank acted .
but maybe the hike is n't working

documents.title: co-op : we 're getting stronger , but profitability will take longer
text: having failed the stress test , the co-op bank has agreed a new revised capital plan '' that will see it sell some of its risk-weighted assets .
co-op bank also insisted that it is making progress to improve its capital position , and is much stronger '' than a year ago .

niall booker , ceo , says : as the regulator notes today , we have achieved the target of building our capital base and the actions we have taken during the first year of our business plan have made the bank more secure for the benefit of all stakeholders .

our key ratios around capital , liquidity and leverage at the present time are significantly strengthened , we 're ahead of schedule in the disposal of non-core assets and the stability of our core franchise is improving .
however , given we are in the early stage of our plan , the original capital deficit and the nature of our assets , it is no surprise that we have not met the severe stress test hurdle today .
but co-op has also admitted that it will probably not be profitable in 2014 , 2015 and 2016 , and expects the non-core division of the bank to be significantly reduced in size by 2017 .
previously , it had hoped that it might return to profitability in 2016 .
an important point - the bank of england said that while the banking system was stronger than the 2008 banking crisis there were still other concerns .
recent misconduct and other operational failings have highlighted that rebuilding confidence in the banking system requires ore than financial resilience .

that , and changes to banks ' business models in response to commercial and regulatory developments , make it important for banks to continue to enhance the effectiveness of their governance arrangements . ''
sandy chen , banking analyst of cenkos , says he does n't see any alarm for lloyds and rbs in today 's results .
he points out , though , that lloyds has n't made any comments about potentially resuming the dividend this morning

documents.title: analyst reaction starts here
text: gary greenwood , analyst at shore capital , reckons that today 's report should pave the way for lloyds to resume dividend payments to shareholders next spring .
that 's around six years after it halted payments after being bailed out by the government .
rbs shareholders will probably to wait until 2017 , greenwood adds .
a virtual hat-tip to the telegraph 's james titcomb for summing up today 's results in three emojis .
james titcomb ( @ jamestitcomb ) stress tests in emoji form : co-op � rbs and lloyds � everyone else �
here 's jill treanor 's news story on today 's bank stress tests : bank stress tests : co-op fails as lloyds and rbs scrape through

documents.title: a quick recap
text: a reminder , if you 're just joining us , of the details of today 's uk bank stress tests ( highlights start here ) .

eight uk banks were probed to see how their capital reserves would cope in an adverse scenario , in which britain suffered a steep recession , the pound slumped , inflation soared , interest rates were hiked , the jobless rate doubled and house prices crashed .
the bank of england concluded that co-op 's capital reserves would be wiped out .
rbs and lloyds were also found to be too weak at the end of 2013 , but both banks showed that they have improved their capital positions this year .

documents.title: financial stability report : the key charts
text: and these two charts , from the boe 's financial stability report , show how how global growth prospects have weakened since the spring boe financial stability report of england while fears of a financial crisis hitting the uk have risen a little financial stability report of england

documents.title: bank of england : global risks have increased since june .
text: the bank of england has also declared that the outlook for the global economy has darkened in the last six months , as political tensions grow .
the warning comes in its latest financial stability report ( pdf ) , released alongside today 's stress tests .
the boe says : the global economic outlook has weakened since the june 2014 report and market concerns over persistent weak nominal growth and geopolitical risk have increased .

these developments could affect the outlook for financial stability in the united kingdom if concerns about persistent low growth lead to a sudden reappraisal of underlying vulnerabilities in highly indebted economies , or if a shift in global risk appetite triggers sharp adjustments in financial markets and undermines business and household confidence .
the recent sharp fall in the oil price should support global and uk growth , but it also entails some risk to financial stability .
adjustments will be more disruptive if investors ' pricing of liquidity risk does not fully reflect structural changes in market liquidity .
such developments could lead to stress in funding markets for banks and corporates .
in the committee 's view , these global risks to the outlook for financial stability have increased since june .

the bank also believes that the uk housing market does not pose a greater risk to stability than in june , but debt levels in the uk household sector remain high relative to incomes and the insurance '' .
the uk government argues that today 's stress test should help build a a stronger and safer banking system '' .

andrea leadsom , economic secretary to the treasury , says : ensuring banks ' balance sheets are strong enough to weather future financial storms is a key part of this plan , which is why we welcome today 's stress test results .
these new , tougher tests are a central part of our radical banking reforms and show that the system we put in place is working . ''
the bank of england does n't pull its punches over lloyds and rbs - both banks , it says , are susceptible to a severe economic downturn '' .
for rbs , it says : in particular , the analysis highlights the potential downside risk which may stem from the group 's retail and corporate lending portfolios and an exposure to misconduct risks .

the message to lloyds is subtly different , reflecting its greater focus on the uk property market : in particular , the analysis highlights the potential downside risk which may stem from the group 's retail and commercial lending portfolios and an exposure to misconduct risks faced by the firm .
on the question of misconduct both banks have been penalised by regulators in recent years .
for example , rbs was fined £ 390m for its role in the libor scandal , while lloyds was ordered to pay £ 218m .

documents.title: stress tests , the key charts
text: the purple bars in this chart show how lloyds and rbs 's capital ratios fell to just 5 % and 4.6 % respectively under the bank 's stress tests ( before they improved their situation in 2014 ) , while the co-op was wiped out .
uk bank stress tests of england while this chart shows how co-op , lloyds , santander and nationwide are all particularly exposed to the uk housing market .
bank stress test results of england
mark carney , governor of the bank of england , says the stress test should give us confidence in the strength of the uk banking sector : this was a demanding test .

the results show that the core of the banking system is significantly more resilient , that it has the strength to continue to serve the real economy even in a severe stress , and that the growing confidence in the system is merited . ''
richard partington ( @ rjpartington ) rbs passed stress tests with 4.6 % - only just above the 4.5 % minimum required
this chart show how co-op 's capital reserves would be wiped out in the adverse scenario used by the boe , to minus 2.6 % of assets .
bank stress test results of england the second and third columns show how lloyds and rbs have already improved their capital positions since the end of 2013 .
those 'strategic management actions ' mean the two banks are n't being told to raise more capital .
the stress test results are online here .
barclays , hsbc , nationwide , santander uk and standard chartered have all been given a clean bill of health .

documents.title: bank stress tests results released
text: the bank of england 's stress tests are out .
and the top line is that the co-operative bank , lloyds and royal bank of scotland all fallen short of the stringent test .
lloyds and rbs have already strengthened themselves since the examination was conducted , so have n't technically failed .
they 've only just scraped though .
the co-op 's capital reserves would have been drained by the conditions in the stress tests ( a sharp recession , sharply higher inflation and unemployment ) , the boe said .
the co-op was forced to resubmit its capital plan , as its capital buffer would be negative in the event of a major economic crisis .

jill treanor ( @ jilltreanor ) three banks -co-op and bailed out lloyds and rbs - need more capital , the bank of england said jill treanor ( @ jilltreanor ) co-op 's capital would be `` exhausted '' after the bank of england 's test martin arnold ( @ mamdorsky ) the big loser from uk stress tests is the co-op bank , the only one forced to resubmit its plan after its capital ratio fell from 7.2 to -2.6
we 're about to get a flurry of announcements .
the bank of england will release the results of the stress tests , and also unlock the doors to let out the journalists who 've been briefed on the details since 5am .
and the banks should all issue their own statements

documents.title: who might pass and who might fail ?
text: the eight institutions being tested are barclays , lloyds banking group , hsbc , royal bank of scotland , santander , standard chartered , co-operative bank and the nationwide building society .
the co-op bank has already laid the ground for failure , saying it would be no surprise '' if it did n't pass the boe 's test .
that makes sense - the troubled lender it has already raised almost £ 2bn to cover a black hole in its books .
rbs will want to avoid a repeat of its embarrassment over the eu stress tests - it admitted messing up its numbers so it actually only narrowly passed .
lloyds shareholders should cross their fingers and hope it sails through ; a weak results could make it harder to restart its dividend .
and if standard chartered does poorly , investors may fret about its exposure to emerging markets in asia jill treanor 's preview piece from the observer has more details
today 's examination should be more rigorous than the europe-wide stress tests announced back in october ( which barclays , hsbc , lloyds and rbs passed ) .

the bank of england is using subjective measures of a bank 's financial health , such as the type of capital that is being accumulated and the extent to which the lender has been able to anticipate risks .
it is also tougher ; the 35 % fall in house prices is nearly twice as severe as the 20 % in the eba test .
jill treanor ( @ jilltreanor ) bank of england stress tests : what are the banks being tested on ?

documents.title: introduction : uk bank stress tests released
text: good morning .
we 're about to learn which of britain 's banks are strong enough to survive a major economic turmoil , and which would be sunk .
the bank of england is releasing the details of its detailed stress tests into the uk banking sector , at 7am gmt .

seven banks , and the nationwide building society , have been put through their paces by boe officials to see if they would cope if britain tumbled into a steep recession , the housing market turned sour , and inflation and joblessness rocketed .
the test is based on the stuff of economic nightmares .

it models the following : the economy shrinking by 3.5 % in 2015 interest rates soaring from 0.5 % to 4 % , unemployment doubling to 12 % house prices tumbling 35 % inflation hitting 6.5 % and a 30 % slump in the value of the pound do n't worry , the bank does n't think this is all going to happen ( or if it does , it 's keeping quiet about it ) .
but it wants british bankers to be prepared for the worst .
banks who fail the test will be instructed to raise more capital , by selling assets or tapping shareholders .
but a bank which passes could still be ordered to make changes , if boe officials think it 's being too risky .
a group of journalists , including my colleague jill treanor , are currently locked in the bowels of the bank , being briefed about the tests results .
we 'll get all the details from 7am , along with the bank of england 's latest financial stability report .
and there 's a press conference scheduled for 9am , led by governor mark carney .
but that 's not all today 's diary is packed with stuff .
we also get the latest uk inflation data due at 9.30am ; it may have slowed in november , from 1.3 % in october .
a flurry of manufacturing data is being released , from asia to europe to america .
the early data from china is n't great - its factory sector contracted last month .
the zew survey of german investor confidence being released at 10am gmt .
and we 'll have one eye on the russian rouble , after interest rates were hiked to 17 % ( ! ! )
last night , and the other eye on greece as it prepares for a presidential vote which could prompt a snap general elections .
mike bird ( @ birdyword ) japanese , chinese , uk and ez manufacturing pmis tomorrow , along with uk bank stress tests , uk cpi and zew confidence .
